footer.text: See 'sudo info ubuntu' for more information about Ubuntu.

fields.value: • Budgie is basically a more customizable version of GNOME.
fields.name: <:SeemsGood:478441196755091461> Advantages of Ubuntu Budgie

fields.value: • Relatively new Ubuntu flavor and is still rough around the edges in some areas.
fields.name: <:glare:504911469943717909> Disadvantages of Ubuntu Budgie

fields.value:
If you like stock Ubuntu, but it isn't quite customizable enough for you, Ubuntu Budgie may be the distribution for you.
**[Download Ubuntu Budgie](http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/ubuntu-budgie/releases/20.04/release/)**

If you'd like something even lighter on system resources than Ubuntu Budgie, we recommend checking out Xubuntu (see `sudo info xubuntu`), Ubuntu MATE (see `sudo info ubuntu mate`), or Kubuntu (see `sudo info kubuntu`).
fields.name: <:think:585665071938666508> Should You Use Ubuntu Budgie?

description:
Ubuntu Budgie is an [official Ubuntu flavor](https://ubuntu.com/download/flavours) that uses the [Budgie Desktop Environment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Budgie_(desktop_environment\)).  As is the case with all [official Ubuntu flavors](https://ubuntu.com/download/flavours), Ubuntu Budgie has access to all of the packages in Ubuntu's repositories and can use PPAs created for Ubuntu.
**[Screenshots of Ubuntu Budgie](https://ubuntubudgie.org/portfolio/screenshots)**
